attachments.fallback:
patch 8.1.2035: recognizing octal numbers is confusing

Problem:    Recognizing octal numbers is confusing.
Solution:   Introduce scriptversion 4: do not use octal and allow for single
            quote inside numbers.
attachments.title: patch 8.1.2035: recognizing octal numbers is confusing
attachments.text:
patch 8.1.2035: recognizing octal numbers is confusing

Problem:    Recognizing octal numbers is confusing.
Solution:   Introduce scriptversion 4: do not use octal and allow for single
            quote inside numbers.

text: エラーになるようになったのはいいですね

このスレで言ってる通り `1'000'000.00` みたいに書けるようにしてるっぽくてテストが一部落ちてます (修整されましたが)
<https://github.com/vim/vim/issues/4921#issuecomment-530991778>
<https://vim-jp.slack.com/archives/C0NUFLFU3/p1568552237001100>

attachments.fallback: GitHub: ":echo 09" should raise error · Issue #4921 · vim/vim
attachments.title: ":echo 09" should raise error · Issue #4921 · vim/vim
attachments.text: :echo 0xg ↓ E15: Invalid expression: 0xg I think It's OK. :echo 09 ↓ 9 It's not good because an octal number starts with a zero and 09 should take care as invalid octal number.
